es.ucm.fdi.tp.practica6.ataxx.evaluator

Class ComplexEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ucm.fdi.tp.practica6.ataxx.evaluator.AtaxxEvaluator
      • es.ucm.fdi.tp.practica6.ataxx.evaluator.ComplexEvaluator

  • public class ComplexEvaluator
extends AtaxxEvaluator
    An Ataxx evaluator which takes into account different weighted factors to generate the score. The factors are: - Number of pieces in the board. - How grouped the pieces are. - How many "holes" (empty spaces surrounded by allies) are in the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      ComplexEvaluator()
      Creates a complex evaluator with default value for the parameters.
      ComplexEvaluator(double pieceCountWeight, double proximityWeight)
      Creates a complex evaluator with the provided weights for each factor.

      • ComplexEvaluator

        public ComplexEvaluator(double pieceCountWeight,
                double proximityWeight)
        Creates a complex evaluator with the provided weights for each factor.
        Parameters:
        pieceCountWeight - the weight of the number of pieces.
        proximityWeight - the weight of the grouping.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the weights are negative or if their sum is greater than 1.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(Board board,
              java.util.List<Piece> pieces,
              Piece turn,
              Piece p)
        Description copied from class: AtaxxEvaluator
        Evaluates how close the player p is to winning (1) or losing (-1). To be used in the automatic players. This method should at least return the neutral value (0) if there is no actual underlying algorithm that evaluates.

        The method must be called with a board that is InPlay, it cannot be called with a finished game.

        Specified by:
        evaluate in class AtaxxEvaluator
        Parameters:
        board - The current board of the game.
        pieces - The list of pieces involved in the game (each correspond to a player).
        turn - The piece to be played next.
        p - The piece w.r.t which we want to make the evaluation
        Returns:
        How close the player turn is to winning (1) or losing (-1). The value 0 is neutral.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

        toString in class java.lang.Object
